title: Practice Challenge
description:
Given this HTML:
  • Home
  • About
  • Contact
Write JavaScript using querySelector to: 1. Find the active menu item 2. Find all menu items 3. Find the primary button 4. Find all buttons 5. Log the text of the active item
instructions:
Given this HTML:
  • Home
  • About
  • Contact
Write JavaScript using querySelector to: 1. Find the active menu item 2. Find all menu items 3. Find the primary button 4. Find all buttons 5. Log the text of the active item

hints.text: Use '.item.active' for active item, '.item' for all items, '.primary' for primary button, 'button' for all buttons

commonMistakes.consequence: This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
commonMistakes.correction:
Forgetting the . or # prefix:
   document.querySelector('myClass')  // WRONG - looks for <myClass> tag
   document.querySelector('.myClass')  // CORRECT - looks for class

commonMistakes.mistake: Expecting querySelectorAll to be an array:
commonMistakes.consequence: This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
commonMistakes.correction:
Expecting querySelectorAll to be an array:
   let items = document.querySelectorAll('.item');
   items.map(...)  // ERROR - NodeList doesn't have map
   
   Convert first:
   Array.from(items).map(...)
   // Or use forEach (works on NodeList):
   items.forEach(...)
